moves.1. b4: A modern chess master, with encyclopedic knowledge of every opening [even the unusual ones], would have no problem with this move. But Gerlach is caught off guard.
moves.1... d5: Gerlach responds by placing a Pawn in the center.
moves.2... e6: Guarding his advanced Pawn and opening a line for his KB.
moves.3. e3: Hoping to sucker Gerlach into his pitfall.
moves.3... Bxb4: Winning a Pawn is a good move....
moves.4. Bxg7: ...but winning a Rook is a better one! Gerlach of course resigned.
